intro: Hibbertia diffusa var. canescens, commonly known as the silver-leafed hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with red markings, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal and heathland environments. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
